description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Antalya's Embrace" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Antalya's Embrace

places.generalDescription: Antalya Kalei√ßi Ancient City & Marina is a charming maze of cobbled streets and narrow alleys, now home to boutique hotels, souvenir shops, art galleries, and restaurants. This ancient world atmosphere offers a lot of tourist attractions including a main square with a stone gate and clock tower. The Tekeli Muhammad Pasha mosque from the eighteenth century is worth visiting for its amazing designs and fragrant atmosphere.

sources.snippet: The marina is a picturesque spot where you can watch boats come and go while enjoying the cool sea breeze. It's also an excellent place for taking photos together. Dine at Lara Balƒ±k Evi, which offers fresh seafood and stunning views of the marina.
sources.shortName: Romantic Antalya Getaway 4 Days: Itinerary 2025

places.name: Antalya Kalei√ßi Ancient City & Marina

reviews.text:
Good afternoon out, the Rolex watches and other  designer goods are really cheap!!
Pleasant harbour and boat trips if you like that sort of thing. The old town is well worth a look

A Stunning Historic Gem by the Sea

Kalei√ßi Marina is absolutely magical! Nestled in the heart of Antalya's Old Town, this picturesque harbor is a perfect blend of history, charm, and coastal beauty. Surrounded by ancient city walls, colorful boats, and charming cafes, it feels like stepping into a Mediterranean postcard.

The views of the turquoise sea and rugged cliffs are breathtaking, especially at sunset. It's the perfect place to stroll, relax, or take a boat tour along the coast. The nearby shops and restaurants add to the lively, yet laid-back vibe.

A must-visit when in Antalya-romantic, scenic, and full of character. Five stars all the way!

Great place to visit. The boat riding was an amazing experience.
You will see beautiful sceneries during your boat trip.

places.generalDescription: Duden Waterfalls is a natural wonder located in a park, featuring upper waterfalls of a partly underground river that cascade in front of a cave. The site offers an opportunity for outdoor adventures and sightseeing, making it an ideal destination for nature enthusiasts and history buffs alike. With its picturesque surroundings and historical significance, Duden Waterfalls is a must-visit attraction on the Mediterranean coast of Turkey.

sources.snippet: The fact that there‚Äôs a huge, simply stunning waterfall right in the middle of a city is pretty mindblowing. A visit to Duden Waterfalls is one of the coolest things to do in Antalya ‚Äì it‚Äôs low-cost and well worth the experience. You can stand right on the edge and look down as the water cascades and then thunders down into the sea, creating rainbows amidst the fog and foam.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things To Do in Antalya, Turkey

sources.snippet: Discover D√ºden Waterfalls in Antalya, where the D√ºden River cascades over dramatic cliffs into the Mediterranean Sea. With lush greenery, misty trails, and a serene ambience, this natural attraction offers a tranquil escape. Explore caves behind the falls, stroll through surrounding parks, and soak in the beauty of this unforgettable Turkish gem.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Antalya 2024: Upto 40% Off

sources.snippet: While there are a number of waterfalls in Duden Park, the most impressive is unquestionably the Lower Duden Waterfall at Karpuzkaldiran - here, the water dramatically pours from the Duden River over the cliff edge and lunges into the sea below. It really is a magnificent spectacle to behold!
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do In Antalya For Couples

sources.snippet: Just a short drive away, the cascading Duden Waterfalls and Kur≈üunlu Waterfall provide lush green escapes ideal for photography and picnics.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Antalya Turkey | Tourist Spots: Ancient Cities, Beaches, Waterfalls, Ski Resort
Where To Go For A Honeymoon In Antalya
Antalya Romantic Activities - 11 Best Romantic Activities

places.name: Duden Waterfalls

reviews.text: D√ºden Waterfall is a beautiful spot well worth a visit while in Antalya! There's a convenient autopark right at the entrance for just 20 TL, which made access super easy. Entry prices vary for locals and foreigners, which might catch some off guard, but it's understandable and helps keep sites like this affordable for residents. The waterfall itself is stunning, with lush greenery and a peaceful atmosphere. One of the highlights is the cave that runs behind the waterfall. It's such a unique experience to walk through and see the water cascading from behind. However, if you're tall or have mobility issues, be cautious. The cave has some low ceilings and uneven steps that can be tricky. Still, it's an amazing natural site that's definitely worth checking out. Whether you're a local or a visitor, it's a relaxing and memorable way to spend an afternoon.

One of the best waterfalls in this area. There is a car park in front of the entry point. Parking and entry tickets are not expensive.
You need to walk a bit from the entrance to reach the falls, please mind your head as some places rocks are very low. Caverns are worth going into for going behind the falls but mind there is some water dripping there.
There are gift shops, souvenir, restaurants available. Good place to spend a couple of hours.

The entrance fee is very affordable, only around 2-3 euros per person, and it's worth every cent! The scenery is absolutely stunning ‚Äì if you're a nature lover, you will enjoy it to the fullest. Lush greenery surrounds the powerful waterfalls, creating a refreshing and relaxing atmosphere.
There are small shops selling souvenirs, ice creams, and slushies, as well as local ladies preparing traditional Turkish treats on the spot ‚Äì perfect for a quick taste of local flavors before or after your walk.
Overall, a must-visit spot if you love being close to nature.

places.address: Varsak Mahallesi D√ºden ≈ûelalesi Parkƒ± i√ßi, Kepez/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Titanic Deluxe Lara is a modern resort that resembles an ocean liner and offers a variety of amenities. Situated in Antalya, Turkey, the resort overlooks the Mediterranean Sea and features lush gardens and soft sandy beaches. Guests can enjoy top-rated 5-star facilities for land and water activities, sports options, a world-class spa, and diverse dining experiences. The resort also provides day and night entertainment for relaxation and recreation.
places.name: Titanic Deluxe Lara

reviews.text:
Ruslan was our waiter in our cabana and he was amazing!! The service was so good, we would highly recommend booking a cabana.
The kids club was fantastic, our children loved it.

The hotel itself is stunning and the rooms were lovely and clean. Staff throughout were helpful, polite and went above and beyond every time we spoke to them.

We would highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to return again.

So much choice for food and drinks. Our son is a very fussy eater and we always found something for him. The staff were so helpful in helping us accommodate him.

First time at Titantic Delux, Lara - wow what a fantastic time we have had.
From pre arrival where Misafir from guest services was super helpful with my allergies query and sorting out a cabana before arrival. Upon check in, Oyesa was amazing, having all the notes Misafir and ensured we knew all we needed.
The hotel was stunning, clean and prestige - everyone takes pride in the place. The rooms were spectacular with so many toiletries provided and so spacious even for the three of us in a standard room.
The oools, the bars, the food and entertainment are all great. We had the best time.

H√ºseyin at the cabana who looked after us the heavenly beds (by the pool) was superb. So friendly, attentive and ensured we had everything and more. Couldn't ask for more .

The kids club - Kikoa Club and the team (Azra, Daria and the other girls) were fabulous. My little one (11yr old boy) absolutely adored them all and was hard work getting him out as loved it so much.

Thank you. We will be back.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

I can honestly say that my stay at this hotel was nothing short of fantastic. From the moment I arrived, the staff made me feel incredibly welcome and went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect. The check-in process was smooth and efficient, and I was immediately impressed by the cleanliness, style, and overall atmosphere of the hotel.

My room was spotless, comfortable, and well-equipped with everything I needed for a relaxing stay. The bed was extremely comfortable, and I slept so well each night. The attention to detail throughout the room, from the d√©cor to the amenities, really made it feel special.

The facilities were excellent ‚Äì whether it was the dining options, common areas, or leisure spaces, everything was maintained to the highest standard. I especially appreciated how attentive and friendly the staff were at all times. They were always available to help and genuinely seemed to care about making guests happy.

Overall, I loved my time here and could not recommend this hotel highly enough. It exceeded all my expectations, and I will definitely be returning in the future. A well deserved 5 star

places.address: Merkezi, G√ºzeloba, Lara Turizm Yolu, 07230 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Hadrian's Gate is a significant historical site in Antalya, Turkey. It is a Roman triumphal arch built in 130 AD to commemorate Emperor Hadrian's visit to Attaleia. The gate consists of three identical marble, granite, and stone archways standing 8m tall and is considered the most beautiful in Pamphylia. It bears marks and additions from various civilizations that followed Hadrian. The two towers flanking the entrance are from different time periods.

sources.snippet: Head to Hadrian‚Äôs Gate (known as √ú√ßkapƒ±lar to Turks), a stately triple-arched structure of white marble, built in honour of the emperor‚Äôs visit in AD 130. Step through it to re-enter the modern world of AtatuÃàrk Caddesi. Here you will find a palm-tree-lined street which bursts with energy from the ringing bell of the period tram that trundles past - and an ever-changing collection of restaurants, caf√©s and clothes shops.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Antalya

sources.snippet: This ancient Roman triumphal arch is one of the most significant historical landmarks in Antalya and offers a glimpse into the city's rich past. Stroll through the gate and take in the intricate carvings and architecture that have stood the test of time. Afterward, head to Caf√© Mado for a delightful breakfast with a view of the bustling city.
sources.shortName: Romantic Antalya Getaway 4 Days: Itinerary 2025

sources.snippet: Hadrian's Gate in Antalya, Turkey, is a giant ancient Roman triumphal arch that symbolizes the rich history and culture of the city. The Gate was constructed back in the 2nd century AD to honor the visit of the Emperor Hadrian.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Antalya 2024: Upto 40% Off

places.name: Hadrian's Gate

reviews.text: Nice place. Remnants of the Roman influence on this part of the world. Made in typical Roman architecture, the pillars stand testimony to their building skills and the fact that still exist in great condition despite the humidity and salty air in Antalya is testimony to their prowess. Great place to take photos and videos. Saw a lot of people also doing li e streams here.

If you are in the area, worth viewing. I wouldn't recommend driving a long distance to go view. These photos are all there is to see in my opinion. Too many modern architecture surrounding it. Old meets new.

Old town is beautiful. Reminds me of a lot of European old towns. Because a lot of them were under Ottoman empire back in the days.  Recommending to visit morning or evening because of the afternoon heat. üòÅ

places.address: Barbaros, Atat√ºrk Cd, Hadrian Kale Kapƒ±sƒ±, 07100 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Perge Ancient City, located just 18km north of Antalya, is a significant site in ancient Pamphylia. It has a rich history dating back to the Hittites around 1500 BCE and was inhabited continuously until the Byzantine era. The city was ruled by various powers including the Persians, Athenians, Alexander the Great, and the Romans.

sources.snippet: Marvel at the theaters of Aspendos and Perge, stroll through the ruins of Termessos, or sail to Phaselis, an ancient harbor city enveloped in pine forests. Don't miss the mystical flames of Yanartas (Chimera) near Cirali Beach‚Äîa natural wonder that has burned for thousands of years.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Antalya Turkey | Tourist Spots: Ancient Cities, Beaches, Waterfalls, Ski Resort

sources.snippet: Visit Perge, an ancient city near Antalya, known for its well-preserved Greco-Roman ruins. The stadium, theatre, and towering Hellenistic gate showcase its historical grandeur. Stroll the collonaded streets and see ancient baths here.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Antalya 2024: Upto 40% Off

sources.snippet: You could also explore the ancient ruins of Perge or Aspendos, or simply stroll hand-in-hand through the charming streets of Kaleici, soaking in the city's rich history and culture.
sources.shortName: A Guide to Planning a Memorable Surprise Proposal in Antalya
Where To Go For A Honeymoon In Antalya

places.name: Perge Ancient City

reviews.text: Atmospheric place to discover old ruins of ancient Roman city. Touching the ruins gave me goosebumps because every stone is a history. I wandered around it for three whole hours. But that's a bummer that amphitheater was closed. Definitely worth to visit this place! Comfortable shoes recommended, and also bring your own water, as local museum shop is too expensive and it's very hot here. Entry ticket was ‚Ç¨11.

Really such a unique place. The scale of the site is phenomenal. The structures at times are massive. It's wonderful. The site is still under excavation, they'll find so so so much more under all the mounds and hills - how thrilling. They now charge a car parking fee of 30 tl plus the ‚Ç¨11 entrance fee. Minus one star because of two reasons: 1. No audio guide was available and what limited written information was available on-site is poorly written from a tourists' point of view. It was clearly written by an academic who assumes you know the function of each building, it needs to be less technical and more descriptive. An audio guide would have been great here. 2. A lot more needs to be done to preserve the ruins - you have people climbing all over them and exposed mosaics that people can walk on and very little is being done to prevent it. Also, there are collapsed fences, signs and excavation equipment all over the place - it needs a tidy up. Otherwise it's just wonderful, give yourself nearly 3 hours to see everything.

I would visit this place again in a heartbeat! This was my first experience with seeing ancient Roman architecture and I loved it!

I was a bit short on time, so I was only able to stay for about an hour and a half, but I could easily spend 3-4 hours here if I wasn't pressed for time.

places.generalDescription: The Antalya Archaeology Museum, situated in the Konyaalti district of Antalya, is a vast Anatolian history museum that showcases an extensive collection of artifacts spanning over 5,000 years. With 13 exhibition halls and an open-air gallery covering more than 75,000 square feet, the museum displays archaeological finds from various periods including Roman, Phrygian, Byzantine and more.

sources.snippet: Antalya Archaeology Museum is one of the best museums I‚Äôve ever been to, and I found it refreshing to find something so historic and educational in the middle of a place famed for beach time. This is one of the best things to do in Antalya if you‚Äôre a history fan, and the exhibits are really easy to follow; making it great for families too. There are so many historical activities to do in Antalya, it‚Äôs is an open-air museum in so many ways, but a few hours spent in this museum will teach you a lot about days gone by.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things To Do in Antalya, Turkey

sources.snippet: Initiated in 1922 by Suleyman Fikri Erten during Italy's occupation, the Antalya Archaeological Museum in the Konyaalti district showcases over 5,000 artifacts. These relics, ranging from textiles and coins to statues and mosaics, trace Antalya's evolution from the Stone Age through the Ottoman Empire. A special children's section offers a unique glimpse into ancient toys.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Antalya Turkey | Tourist Spots: Ancient Cities, Beaches, Waterfalls, Ski Resort

sources.snippet: There are many tourist destinations, but the Museum is one of the places to visit in Antalya2 to enjoy and learn from the past. The Antalya Museum is spread over an extensive area of 30,000 sq. ft. with 13 capacious halls, an open-air art gallery, laboratories, repair shops, administrative offices, living quarters, and a cafeteria.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Antalya 2024: Upto 40% Off

sources.snippet: Continue your historical exploration by visiting Antalya Museum (Antalya Muzesi). This museum houses an impressive collection of artifacts from various periods, including Roman, Byzantine, and Ottoman eras. Spend a few hours marveling at the exhibits and learning about Antalya's diverse history.
sources.shortName: Romantic Antalya Getaway 4 Days: Itinerary 2025

places.name: Antalya Archaeology Museum

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing museum to visit, so many relics of history. They have several languages available for audio guides, and they also have Turkish and English signs and descriptions. There's a cute gift shop at the end where you can also sit and rest up after walking around.

The Antalya Archaeology Museum is a great place to explore, especially if you enjoy Roman history - they have an impressive collection of statues, mosaics, and artifacts.

Entry is about 30 GBP per person for foreigners, which feels a bit expensive but the exhibits are well worth it.

One thing to note: they try to sell you an audio guide at the entrance, but honestly, it's not really worth the extra cost - the museum has plenty of written descriptions in English.

Overall, a beautiful and rich museum experience, just be mindful of the extras.

Interesting and very well maintained museum, not too big - you will probably not get too tired :) Too expensive though...‚Ç¨15 for the entrance fee without the audio guide, which costs extra (‚Ç¨5-7)....And no WI-FI available for visitors..

places.address: Bah√ßelievler, Konyaaltƒ± Cd. No:88, 07050 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: The Antalya Clock Tower is a historic stone landmark dating back to the 9th century, featuring a pentagonal base and a crenellated tower with four clock faces. It stands as the only remaining tower out of 80 columns that once formed Antalya's ancient stone wall. Built in 1909 AD by orders of the Ottoman Sultan Abdul Hamid II, this iconic structure serves as a focal point in Antalya's Old Town.

sources.snippet: Start your third day with a visit to Clock Tower, another iconic landmark in Antalya that dates back to ancient times. The tower stands tall in the heart of Kaleici and provides great photo opportunities. Enjoy breakfast at Vanilla Lounge, known for its cozy atmosphere and delicious breakfast options.
sources.shortName: Romantic Antalya Getaway 4 Days: Itinerary 2025

sources.snippet: It was built in 1901 and is a great example of Ottoman architecture. It is in the middle of Turkey's most beautiful coastal town.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Antalya 2024: Upto 40% Off

places.name: Antalya Clock Tower

reviews.text:
A beautiful place, you can take souvenir photos there or take personal photos, there are all kinds of restaurants and sweets, there is a train track

There is a crossroads to the sea or picnic places, there is a beautiful mosque

You can also get out of the train station or buy anything commemorative or take a taxi, i.e. walk from the crossroads or go in the backyards

There are offers on the tower watch

I loved this place
üíö‚ù§Ô∏è

is a beautiful historic landmark in the heart of the city. Standing tall with its charming stone structure, it reflects Antalya's rich history and culture. The area around the tower is lively, and you can walk through streets filled with cozy cafes, musical bars, and local markets, creating a vibrant and enjoyable atmosphere. Whether you're exploring the old town or just passing by, it's a great spot to soak in the city's charm and energy!

Kaleichi is Antalya's historic old town, known for its narrow winding streets, charming Ottoman-era houses, and vibrant atmosphere. Surrounded by ancient city walls, it's home to beautiful landmarks like Hadrian's Gate and the Clock Tower. The area is packed with cozy cafes, boutique hotels, artisan shops, and lively nightlife, making it a perfect place to explore both day and night. Walking through Kalei√ßi feels like stepping back in time, blending history with modern Turkish culture.

places.generalDescription: Konyaaltƒ± Beaches in Antalya offer a picturesque setting with crystal-clear waters and stunning surroundings, making it an ideal spot for sunbathing, swimming, and enjoying fresh seafood. The well-equipped beach provides amenities such as sun loungers, umbrellas, beach bars, and restaurants. Visitors can also partake in water sports like jet skiing and parasailing. Additionally, the area is known for its large all-inclusive hotels that boast top-notch facilities.

sources.snippet: Discover the sun-soaked Konyaaltƒ± Beach, a stunning 7-kilometre stretch in Antalya. Set against the majestic Taurus Mountains, the pebble and sand shore boasts pristine turquoise waters, bustling cafes, and thrilling water sports. The lively promenade and nearby Aqualand water park complete this vibrant Mediterranean getaway.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Antalya 2024: Upto 40% Off

sources.snippet: Konyaaltƒ± Beach is the main beach in Antalya, and it‚Äôs stunning ‚Äì there‚Äôs no other word for it. The sea is crystal clear, and the mountainous background is breathtaking. The other plus point is that the beach is especially wide and long; meaning there‚Äôs always plenty of space, even when it‚Äôs crowded in summer.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things To Do in Antalya, Turkey

sources.snippet: After your morning adventure, head to Konyaalti Beach (Konyaalti Plaji) for some relaxation by the sea. This popular beach is perfect for sunbathing, swimming, or simply enjoying each other's company under the sun. For lunch, visit BigChefs Konyaaltƒ± located nearby for a variety of tasty dishes.
sources.shortName: Romantic Antalya Getaway 4 Days: Itinerary 2025

sources.snippet: For lovers of the sea, Konyaalti Beach and Lara Beach offer pristine coastlines perfect for sunbathing and swimming. Just a short drive away, the cascading Duden Waterfalls and Kur≈üunlu Waterfall provide lush green escapes ideal for photography and picnics.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Antalya Turkey | Tourist Spots: Ancient Cities, Beaches, Waterfalls, Ski Resort

sources.snippet: Konyaalti Beach is repeatedly mentioned as the best beach in Antalya, and spending a day here is the perfect way to unwind. While the beach is primarily made up of little pebbles, there are pockets of sandy areas where you are able to lay out.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do In Antalya For Couples

sources.snippet: Konyaalti Beach is located just a couple of kilometres away from the centre of Antalya. As such, it is one of the closest beaches to the city. Konyaalti beach is made of a long stretch of pebbles and rough sand
sources.shortName: The BEST Areas in 2024
Where To Go For A Honeymoon In Antalya

places.name: Konyaaltƒ± Beaches

reviews.text: A local recommended this beach, and it did not disappoint! üåä‚ú® It had stunning views of the cliffed edges and ended with a breathtaking sight of the mountains. Since we visited in February, we even got to see snow on the mountain peaks, making it even more special ‚ùÑÔ∏èüèîÔ∏è. The only downside is that the sand isn't golden, but overall, it was a beautiful experience! üòä

I visited Konyaalti Beach on the morning of Saturday, May 24. The water was surprisingly warm and crystal-clear - truly inviting! There were no waves, making it absolutely perfect for swimming. The beach holds a Blue Flag certification, ensuring excellent water quality and cleanliness. The stunning Beydaƒülarƒ± Mountains in the background create a breathtaking view. With well-maintained facilities and nearby cafes, it's a fantastic spot for both relaxation and great photos. Highly recommended!

A stunning beach right in the heart of Antalya. It's popular with both locals and tourists, with plenty of beach chairs, bars, cafes, restaurants, and fast food options lining the sandy shore.

Even at 6am, the area is full of life with people swimming, paddle boarding, exercising, or just relaxing and taking in the view. There's also a lift available if you're coming from the top of the cliff or prefer not to walk down the road

places.generalDescription: TerraCity is a modern and multilevel indoor shopping center located in Antalya, Turkey. It has become a popular destination for locals and tourists due to its 180 stores and restaurants, offering a wide range of national and international brands. The mall's unique concept combines entertainment with shopping, featuring modern architecture, entertainment areas, famous brands, and a 1000-person food and beverage area.

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs very easy to lose a few hours in TerraCity; not only because it‚Äôs so big, but also because it‚Äôs home to a surprising amount of things to do inside. For me, this is one of the best things to do in Antalya for couples, because there are some great restaurants where you can enjoy a quiet meal. If you want to try another shopping center, the Mall of Antalya is also good.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things To Do in Antalya, Turkey

places.name: TerraCity

reviews.text: offering a variety of global brands and Turkish brands alike. The mall is spacious, well-organized, and features a mix of luxury and affordable stores, making it suitable for all budgets. In addition to shopping, there are plenty of dining options, from fast food to high-end restaurants. Whether you're looking for fashion, and there is basement parking as well

TerraCity is one of the best shopping malls in Antalya! Even in Istanbul I don't remember experiencing such a place as I visited almost all malls of Istanbul. It has a great mix of international and local brands, a spacious and clean layout, and plenty of options for dining and coffee. The atmosphere is modern and comfortable, and it's a perfect place to shop, relax, or hang out with friends and family. The staff in most stores are friendly and helpful, and the overall experience is top-notch. Highly recommended if you're in the area!

I absolutely love TerryCity!
It's a beautiful and spacious shopping center with a wide variety of shops and restaurants. Everything is always clean and well-organized, and the staff are incredibly kind, helpful, and welcoming.

You can find so many great quality products here ‚Äì from fashion to electronics, home goods, gifts, and more. The atmosphere is warm and relaxing, making every visit a real pleasure.

Whether you're coming for a quick coffee, a full shopping day, or just to enjoy the vibe ‚Äì TerryCity never disappoints. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a great shopping experience! üíõüõçÔ∏è

places.address: Fener, Tekelioƒülu Cd. No:55, 07160 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Rokka Pizza Falafel is a charming eatery nestled in the heart of Kaleici, Antalya, where Italian and Middle Eastern cuisines beautifully intertwine. This relaxed restaurant boasts an impressive menu filled with vegetarian and vegan delights, from mouthwatering falafel dishes to delectable pizzas. The cozy ambiance invites diners to unwind while enjoying generous portions at reasonable prices. With fresh ingredients and vibrant flavors, Rokka has something for everyone‚Äîwhether you're craving stuffed zucchini flowers or a hearty lentil burger.

sources.shortName: Romantic Antalya Getaway 4 Days: Itinerary 2025

places.name: Rokka Pizza Falafel

reviews.text: Super fun Bohemian vibed restaurant.  Exactly the food my partner and I were wanting to enjoy after hiking all day.  We chose to have a variety of Meze type foods, and enjoyed the Tabouli, Hummus, local Turkish fried cheese, and falafel.  Delicious and highly recommend!

Food was banging!! Everything was simply amazing! We were craving falafel and this place hit the spot perfectly! But the kids wanted chicken. Thank you for having such vegetarian and non-Vegetarian options in one restaurant.
Totally recommended! The dishes were delicious and the prices very reasonable. Many thanks especially to Anas, who was really kind and attentive. Hope to be back soon!

places.address: Ha≈üimi≈ücan, Recep Peker Cd., 07100 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Antalya Aquarium is a popular attraction near Konyaalti Beach, offering themed exhibits, a long tunnel tank, and tropical reptiles. It's known for being the largest aquarium tunnel in the world, making it a must-visit spot for families with children. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll while marveling at an impressive collection of marine life from various seas and oceans, including sharks and other aquatic animals like Sting Rays, Red Dragon Fish, and California Moray.

sources.snippet: Antalya Aquarium, located in Antalya, Turkey, is one of the largest aquarium complexes in the world. It features a variety of themed aquariums that offer visitors a glimpse into diverse marine habitats. The centerpiece is the world's longest aquarium tunnel, spanning 131 meters in length and 3 meters in width, providing an immersive experience as visitors walk through surrounded by marine life.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Antalya 2024: Upto 40% Off

sources.snippet: From breathtaking sunsets to intimate dinners, Antalya offers plenty of romantic activities to pamper yourself with your partner. Here is our list of Antalya romantic activities where you can experience unforgettable moments;
sources.shortName: Antalya Romantic Activities - 11 Best Romantic Activities

sources.snippet: Whether you‚Äôre chasing ancient legends, hidden waterfalls, or golden beaches, the things to visit in Antalya promise an unforgettable adventure through time, culture, and breathtaking natural beauty.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Antalya Turkey | Tourist Spots: Ancient Cities, Beaches, Waterfalls, Ski Resort

places.name: Antalya Aquarium

reviews.text: The aquarium itself was very beautiful. Nothing too different from the others we've been, but still worth to visit if you're there. But the kids were absolutely amazed with the snow room. It's tiny, but has a few ice slides and a cosy little cafeteria.

Overpriced, unfriendly staff, and just not worth it

We were really disappointed with this visit. The aquarium is small for the price-yes, there are some nice fish, but definitely not enough to justify the cost. Not many sharks either, and the so-called ‚Äúlongest tunnel‚Äù wasn't anything special.

What made the experience worse was the staff. They were not friendly at all, and made a fuss because we bought tickets online. It felt like they were trying to find ways to charge us more.

Also, charging kids from 3 years old is just ridiculous. For a place this size, that feels greedy more than anything else.

Unless you get in at a heavily discounted price, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It's clearly a ripoff.

Visited on August 15, 2025. Paid 40 dollars per person as foreing citizens for just aquarium itself. If booked online via the aquarium's official site in advance, it costs 36 dollars instead. Overall it was nice but it is a bit pricey for what it offered.
It is home to the world's largest tunnel aquarium, stretching 131 meters in length. Inside, visitors can marvel at a life-size airplane and shipwreck, while coming face to face with majestic sharks.

places.address: Minicity and Su Hotel eastern corner of Konyaaltƒ± Beach, Arapsuyu, Dumlupƒ±nar Blv. No:502, 07200 Konyaaltƒ±/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Beach Park in Antalya offers a variety of stunning beaches with crystal blue waters. Olympos Beach is an exotic and preserved wild beach, while Alanya Portakal (Orange) Beach boasts a wide sandy stretch. Konyaalti Beach, near the city center, features a 350-meter sandy beach with exclusive private cabanas for a luxurious seaside experience. Oludeniz stands out as a favorite coastal destination with its breathtaking beauty and hidden adventures.
places.name: Beach Park, Antalya

reviews.text:
Antalya - one of the most beautiful places in T√ºrkiye. Love the landscape here.
Incredible beach with beautiful boardwalk with so many restaurants and cafes.
The mountain views in the distance are so dreamy.

The beaches at Beach Park are spectacular! It's a peaceful and well-equipped place. There are changing rooms, showers, restrooms, and restaurants. The beaches are clean, and I personally love that they have pebbles instead of sand. It's my favorite spot in Antalya. The mountains in the background add a magical and special touch to the scenery.

One of the best beach promenades I've been to. You can swim, fish, sun breathe. But also play different sports, there is everything from beach side shacks to high end cafes and beach clubs. There is running track, a cycling track and walking track. I walked nearly 10 kilometers back and forth and enjoyed my to the fullest. Amazing work done by the local authorities

places.generalDescription: Kaputa≈ü Beach is a stunning sandy cove located just a short bus ride away from Kalkan. Nestled at the base of a striking mountain gorge, this tiny beach offers clear blue waters and is accessible via a narrow stairway with around 300 steps. Nearby, there are several other beautiful beaches such as Patara Beach, which is part of a national park and known for its 12-kilometer stretch of sand and turtle sightings.
places.name: Kaputa≈ü Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach, but a little bit crowded. Finding a parking spot along the road is difficult. You have to pay entrance fee 50 TL. If you don't want to pay for sunbed and umbrella there's a space on the left side on the beach where you can set up your camp üòâ

The photo is FEBRUARY!
The beach in winter had an incredible atmosphere. Quiet and empty. All views and nature just for you.

In summer there are sunbeds, a lot of people relax bar-restaurant. There are showers.

In summer there are sunbeds, a lot of people relax bar-restaurant. There are showers.

I've traveled to many coastal towns, but the sea in Ka≈ü is by far the most stunning. Crystal-clear water, breathtaking views, and a feeling of pure serenity - it's a destination that I'll always recommend!! It's like a painting come to life - turquoise, deep blue, and sparkling under the sunlight. It feels untouched and natural, making it one of the most magical experiences I've had traveling ü•πü´∂üèæü´∂üèæ

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the green hills overlooking Keni Alti Beach, 7 Mehmet Restaurant is a traditional eatery just a few kilometers away from Antalya. Boasting a certificate of excellence, this restaurant offers stunning sea views and features seven dining halls. The warm and friendly atmosphere, along with professional and courteous staff, adds to the dining experience.

sources.snippet: A Legacy of Flavors, established in 1937, 7 Mehmet is an emblem of Antalya's culinary tradition, known far beyond Turkey for its blend of modern Mediterranean and traditional Turkish cuisine. The restaurant emphasizes seasonal ingredients across its menu, from fresh vegetables and fruits to quality meats and seafood. Signature dishes include tripe, seasonal cacik variants, lentil fava, lamb tandoori served with rice pilaf, liver, and Antalya-style pumpkin dessert.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Antalya Turkey | Tourist Spots: Ancient Cities, Beaches, Waterfalls, Ski Resort

sources.snippet: Since it‚Äôs huge, it‚Äôs never crowded, so you can have a private experience with your mate. I like to sit outside at the charming tables while eating delicious food under the sky.
sources.shortName: A Guide to a Romantic Honeymoon in Antalya! ‚Äì Turkey Things

places.name: 7 Mehmet

reviews.text:
Dining at 7 Mehmet was a truly unforgettable experience. From the moment we arrived, we were captivated by the incredible sea views-whether you're seated inside, upstairs, on the open or covered terrace, the scenery is absolutely stunning. The ambiance is elegant yet relaxed, spread across two stories with thoughtfully designed spaces that enhance the overall experience.

The service was top-notch: attentive, efficient, and warm without being overbearing. They even offered blankets once the evening breeze picked up-a small but thoughtful touch that really stood out. The bathrooms were spotless, reflecting the same care and attention shown throughout the restaurant.

Now, the food is absolutely phenomenal. This is authentic Turkish cuisine at its finest,  and I couldn't stop ordering. Every single dish was a hit: from the lofte, lamb, and chicken to the tenderloin, and that fava bean appetizer with fried onions-each plate was beautifully prepared and packed with flavor. And the desserts? A dream. The goat milk pistachio ice cream, baked rice pudding, and pumpkin dessert were the perfect finish.

They were also very accommodating of gluten-free allergies, which made the experience even more enjoyable and stress-free.

Yes, it's popular for a reason, so I'd highly recommend making a reservation. From ambiance and food to service and views, everything was flawless. I'm already looking forward to going back-this is a must-visit spot for anyone looking for a 5-star Turkish dining experience in Antalya.

Honestly, I am so disappointed in this place. I made a special reservation here as it was my last night in Turkey and had researched what I thought would be a fabulous dining experience with a spectacular view. Alas, I was woefully disappointed. While the restaurant itself boasts decent views, they are clouded by a perpetual cloud of smoke from everyone smoking and contaminating your food. Service was poor. The hostess had an attitude from the second we arrived and when we asked to be reseated, mere moments after first sitting, because the smoke was so intoxicating it was causing me to cough, she increased her attitude ten fold. It took us over 15 minutes to finally be served - and while the server did bring us our food, he never checked on us or asked us if we needed anything else. I wish I could say the food was good, but it was mediocre at best with nothing being seasoned. My salad still had massive, bitter stalks on the greens making it too tough and bitter to eat.

If you're looking for a nice view, you could perhaps consider this location for a sunset drink but I would highly discourage dinner or spending any meaningful amount of time here.

Expectation was very high vs what I have found.

All menu has different of its kind and great taste especially in starters and salads ,but

- I can't beg waiters to serve
- I can't remind waiters what I ordered again and again
- I can't keep my hands up to catch one waiter
- I am not paying for cold meat due ti slow service

And on top, service is included automatically in the bill.

This is the result that waiters are not caring what they do. Service charge comes automatically.

Probably last time and no recommendation until I hear an improvement.

places.address: Meltem Mahallesi, Atat√ºrk K√ºlt√ºr Parkƒ±, Dumlupƒ±nar Bulvarƒ± No:201, 07030 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Old Town Restaurant- KALEI√áI is located in the heart of Antalya's charming Old Town, surrounded by perfectly restored Ottoman mansions and cobblestone streets. The area offers a blend of historical and natural attractions, from ancient ruins like Phaselis and Aspendos to natural wonders such as Karain Cave and Duden Waterfalls. Visitors can explore boutique hotels, souvenir shops, art galleries, and restaurants while soaking up the old-world ambience.

sources.snippet: In the evening, take a romantic stroll through Antalya Old Town (Kaleici). The narrow cobblestone streets, historic buildings, and charming shops create a magical atmosphere perfect for couples. End your day with dinner at Seraser Fine Dining Restaurant, known for its exquisite dishes and elegant ambiance.
sources.shortName: Romantic Antalya Getaway 4 Days: Itinerary 2025

sources.snippet: Wander through the narrow streets of Kaleici (Old Town), where Ottoman-era houses, ancient walls, and the iconic Hadrian's Gate echo stories of centuries past. Nearby, the majestic Yivli Minaret and Hidirlik Tower stand as timeless guardians overlooking the city‚Äôs historical heart.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Antalya Turkey | Tourist Spots: Ancient Cities, Beaches, Waterfalls, Ski Resort

places.name: Old Town Restaurant 07

reviews.text: I just wanted to say a massive thank you to the Old Town Restaurant. After being scammed on the first day of our trip, we looked on Google for a good restaurant. Luckily, we found one. We ate at the restaurant a few times during our six-day stay in Antalya, and it was absolutely fantastic every time. The food, the hygiene, the staff ‚Äì it was all spot on. The boss is great. After we first visited, he offered us a big free salad each time, and Turkish tea, of course! Yes, Please! ! My kids are big fans of yours ‚Äì you guys are doing a great job!  If you're a first-time tourist, I'd recommend going straight to the Old Town Restaurant for your first meal. That way, you'll quickly learn what to expect from authentic Turkish food and Turkish people. No nonsense here!

Incredibly delicious Turkish food. Sedat is a great host and very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. We highly enjoyed the aubergine with meat dish, Adana kebab, and chicken skewers which were all very flavourful, tender, and well cooked. The aubergine was sensational

Everything was well seasoned and cooked nicely. The restaurant is also very clean and in a great location in the Old Town

Amazing service, very kind and helpful and honest staff. Both dishes were very tasty, juicy and fresh. The brought us free mezze and yoghurt dip with fresh bread before the food which were tasty as well. After lunch they brought us free tea which was very good too.

They will recommend getting salad or soup, or the fresh juice which they also make instead of the bottled juice for example, but up selling is part of any good waiter's job, if you say no they're extremely respectful and polite about it of course.

We came for the reviews and we were not let down, we were very vary of not getting scammed while dining in the center but instead they ended up charging us TOO LITTLE, and when I brought it up with the waiter and then the owner that we should be paying MORE they were super friendly and still charged us the lower amount, so we just tipped instead. Ibrahim was out waiter, and unlike other restaurants, these guys didn't ask us to review them but I feel like it's only fair to appreciate their good work amongst so many other tourist traps.
